intro: Pseudogynoxys berlandieri, commonly known as the Mexican false sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its yellow flowers, which resemble those of the sunflower, bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
